intro: Chilita decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive chilita, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically palmate, with a velvety texture, and it thrives in high-altitude environments. Due to its striking appearance and unique morphology, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
